    • Constructor Detail

      • CombatScene

        public CombatScene(Character character1,
                   Character character2)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        character1 - - This is the first fighting character. This is assumed to be the hero.
        character2 - - This is the second fighting character. This is assumed to be a monster.

    • Method Detail

      • getCombatScene

        public java.lang.String getCombatScene()
        Return a string in the form of characters, representing the combat scenes characters stats. The string is populated with the the characters name, level, health and their skills.

      • addEmptySpace

        private java.lang.String addEmptySpace(int spaces)
        Return a string containing empty space. Used for constructing the combat scene.
        Parameters:
        spaces - - This is the amount of empty spaces needed to be returned as a string.

      • attackWithSkill

        public java.lang.String attackWithSkill(java.lang.String input,
                                        boolean attackFromHero)
        Attack a character with the skill that is defined by the input. A result in the form of a string will also be returned.
        Parameters:
        input - - This must be the index of the skill to use.
        attackFromHero - - This is to determine if the attack is made by a hero or a monster.

      • calculateCharacterDamage

        private int calculateCharacterDamage(Character character,
                                     int skillIndex)
        Calculate the damage dealt by the specified character and it's index of skill. A result in the form of a integer will be returned. The value is randomly chosen between the skills minimum and maximum damage and multiplied by the characters damage.
        Parameters:
        character - - This must a character.
        skillIndex - - This must be the index of the skill to use.

      • getWinner

        public Character getWinner()
        Return the winning character

      • getLoser

        public Character getLoser()
        Return the losing character

      • getTextures

        public java.lang.String getTextures(int textureNumber)
        Return a string texture depending on the given index provided. Four textures is defined.
        Parameters:
        textureNumber - - This must be a value between 0 and 3.
